intro: Chondrilla chinensis, commonly known as Chinese sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low, mat-like growth habit with silver-green, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments due to its succulent leaves and deep root system. Chondrilla chinensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in traditional Chinese medicine.
